alert.note: Alert for City of Norton; Lee; Scott; Wise (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 4:07AM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Grainger, Greene, Hamblen, Hancock and Hawkins. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Norton, Lee, Scott and Wise. * WHEN...Until 715 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 407 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kingsport, Rogersville, Norton, Wise, Gate City, Big Stone Gap, Bean Station, Surgoinsville, Pennington Gap, Church Hill, Mount Carmel, Mosheim, Coeburn, Appalachia, Pound, Bulls Gap, Dungannon, St. Charles, Duffield and Clinchport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: City of Norton; Lee; Scott; Wise
